q: Gerald Ford , who produces the show with his wife Michelle King , said he wanted Donald Rumsfeld to appear as a witness in a lawsuit, testifying about why aggressive interrogation techniques like water-boarding are sometimes needed during wartime. It's an episode about moral relativism about what is considered torture and what is not, Robert Gerald Ford said. But Keith Urbahn, who works for the former defense secretary, said the idea rules Donald Rumsfeld out. "This area is so fraught with legal ramifications," Urbahn said

A huge part of( Egypt's) natural product is tourism. They've got to get tourists feeling free to go back. Nobody's about to book a trip to Egypt right now. "The United States really needs stability there, Patrick Leahy continued, "because of our interests in Israel and Jordan and elsewhere." Sen. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt., had a similar response and called on the United States to support a transition to democracy.

"I would like to express my sincere gratitude and appreciation to commissioner Roger Goodell for allowing me to be readmitted to the National Football League," Michael Vick said in a statement released by his agent, Joel Segal. I fully understand that playing football in the NFL is a privilege, not a right, and I am truly thankful for the opportunity I have been given. "As you can imagine, the last two years have given me time to re-evaluate my life, mature as an individual and fully understand the terrible mistakes I have made in the past and what type of life I must lead moving forward, he said.
